# Drone News 48h Brief — December 03, 2025

_Window: last 48 hours; 57 incidents._

## Summary
In the last 48 hours, multiple drone incidents have raised significant concerns over prison security and criminal activities across various locations. Most notably, several reports highlight the use of drones to smuggle contraband into prisons in Georgia, with alerts from local law enforcement regarding the ongoing threat they pose. On the law enforcement side, drones have been effectively utilized to locate and apprehend burglary and domestic violence suspects. Notably, incidents in Moldova regarding a Russian drone crash and ongoing drone surveillance in Lithuania over border tensions highlight escalating international tensions. Additionally, airport disruptions due to potential drone sightings were reported in Brussels, indicating potential policy implications on drone regulations. Overall, the trends point towards an increasing reliance on drone technology both for illegal activities and law enforcement responses.

**By category:** airport: 2 • arrest: 10 • crash: 4 • interference: 1 • other: 22 • smuggling: 17 • terrorism: 1
**Top queries:** drone arrest (16), drone prison (12), drone incident (11), drone terrorism (6), drone crash (5)
